beginArray().Description: Begins encoding a new array. Each call to this method must be paired with a call to @B_android#util#JsonWriter#endArray_E@.

isLenient().Description: Returns true if this writer has relaxed syntax rules.

setLenient(boolean).Description: Configure this writer to relax its syntax rules. By default, this writer only emits well-formed JSON as specified by Top-level values of any type. With strict writing, the top-level value must be an object or an array. Numbers may be @B_java#lang#Double#isNaN_E@ or @B_java#lang#Double#isInfinite_E@.

Throws: if the JSON document is incomplete.
close().Description: Flushes and closes this writer and the underlying @B_java#io#Writer_E@.

Parameters: String: a string containing only whitespace.
setIndent(java.lang.String).Description: Sets the indentation string to be repeated for each level of indentation in the encoded document. If indent.isEmpty() the encoded document will be compact. Otherwise the encoded document will be more human-readable.

Parameters: double: a finite value. May not be @B_java#lang#Double#isNaN_E@ or @B_java#lang#Double#isInfinite_E@ unless this writer is lenient.
String: the literal string value, or null to encode a null literal.

JsonWriter(java.io.Writer).Description: Creates a new instance that writes a JSON-encoded stream to out. For best performance, ensure @B_java#io#Writer_E@ is buffered; wrapping in @B_java#io#BufferedWriter_E@ if necessary.

flush().Description: Ensures all buffered data is written to the underlying @B_java#io#Writer_E@ and flushes that writer.

Parameters: Number: a finite value. May not be @B_java#lang#Double#isNaN_E@ or @B_java#lang#Double#isInfinite_E@ unless this writer is lenient.

beginObject().Description: Begins encoding a new object. Each call to this method must be paired with a call to @B_android#util#JsonWriter#endObject_E@.

Parameters: String: the name of the forthcoming value. May not be null.

ClassDesc: Writes a JSON (JsonWriter. Each JSON document must contain one top-level array or object. Call methods on the writer as you walk the structure's contents, nesting arrays and objects as necessary: To write @B_android#util#JsonWriter#beginArray_E@. Write each of the array's elements with the appropriate @B_android#util#JsonWriter#value_E@ methods or by nesting other arrays and objects. Finally close the array using @B_android#util#JsonWriter#endArray_E@. To write @B_android#util#JsonWriter#beginObject_E@. Write each of the object's properties by alternating calls to @B_android#util#JsonWriter#name_E@ with the property's value. Write property values with the appropriate @B_android#util#JsonWriter#value_E@ method or by nesting other objects or arrays. Finally close the object using @B_android#util#JsonWriter#endObject_E@. Each JsonWriter may be used to write a single JSON stream. Instances of this class are not thread safe. Calls that would result in a malformed JSON string will fail with an @B_java#lang#IllegalStateException_E@.
